text: Psalm 10
A Prayer for God to Throw down the Wicked
Why, O Yahweh, do you stand far off?
\add Why\add* do you hide\f + \fr 10:1 \ft Or “shut \fq your eyes \ft ” \f* during times of distress?
In arrogance \add the\add* wicked persecutes\f + \fr 10:2 \ft Or “pursues” \f* \add the\add* poor.
Let them be caught in \add the\add* schemes that they devised,
for \add the\add* wicked boasts about the desire of his ⸤heart⸥,\f + \fr 10:3 \ft Literally “soul” \f*
and \add the\add* one greedy for gain curses \add and\add* treats Yahweh with contempt.
⸤With bald-faced pride⸥\f + \fr 10:4 \ft Literally “According to the height of his nose” \f* \add the\add* wicked will not seek \add God\add*.
There is no God in any of his thoughts.
His ways\f + \fr 10:5 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f* endure at all times.\f + \fr 10:5 \ft Hebrew “time” \f*
Your judgments are aloof from him.
\add As for\add* all his enemies, he scoffs at them.
He says in his heart, “I shall not be moved
⸤throughout all generations⸥,\f + \fr 10:6 \ft Literally “for a generation and a generation” \f* \add during\add* which \add I will have\add* no trouble.”
His mouth is filled with cursing,
with deceits and oppression;
under his tongue are trouble and evil.
He sits in ambush in villages;
in the hiding places he kills \add the\add* innocent.
His eyes ⸤lurk⸥\f + \fr 10:8 \ft Literally “lie hid” \f* for \add the\add* helpless.
He lies in ambush ⸤secretly,⸥\f + \fr 10:9 \ft Literally “in the secret places” \f* like a lion in a thicket.
He lies in ambush to seize \add the\add* poor;
he seizes \add the\add* poor by catching him in his net.
He is crushed;\f + \fr 10:10 \ft Or “and he \fq the wicked \ft stoops” \f* he is bowed down;\f + \fr 10:10 \ft Or “he \fq the wicked \ft crouches” \f*
so\f + \fr 10:10 \ft Or “and” \f* the helpless host\f + \fr 10:10 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f* falls by his ⸤might⸥.\f + \fr 10:10 \ft Literally “mighty ones” \f*
He says in his heart, “God has forgotten.
He has hidden his face.
He never sees.”
Rise up, O Yahweh;
O God, lift up your hand.
Do not forget \add the\add* afflicted.
Why does the wicked treat God with contempt?
He says in his heart, “You will not call \add me\add* to account.”
\add But\add* you have seen; indeed you have noted trouble and grief
to take \add it\add* into your hand.
The helpless abandons \add himself\add* upon you;
you have been \add the\add* helper \add for the\add* orphan.
Break \add the\add* arm of \add the\add* wicked,
and \add as for the\add* evil \add man\add*—
seek out his wickedness \add until\add* you find none.
Yahweh \add is\add* king forever and ever;
the nations have perished from his land.
\add The\add* longing of \add the\add* afflicted you have heard, O Yahweh.
You will make their heart secure. You will ⸤listen attentively⸥\f + \fr 10:17 \ft Literally “cause your ear to hear” \f*
to render judgment \add for the\add* fatherless and \add the\add* oppressed
\add so that\add* a \add mere\add* mortal from the earth will no longer cause terror.
